meanings.definition: A combination of circumstances or events.
meanings.sent1: The conjuncture of good weather and a long weekend made for a perfect camping trip.
meanings.sent2: The conjuncture of traffic jams and road closures caused chaos in the city.
meanings.sent3: At the conjuncture of a surprise party and a power outage, we had to celebrate in the dark!
meanings.sent4: The conjuncture of laughter and tears at the comedy show moved the audience deeply.
meanings.sent5: The conjuncture of a rainbow and a waterfall created a breathtaking view.

meanings.sent1: The conjuncture of the deadline approaching and the printer breaking down stressed everyone out.
meanings.sent2: At the conjuncture of the race, the runners gave their final burst of energy.
meanings.sent3: The conjuncture of the cake being ready and the guests arriving late made for a funny party.
meanings.sent4: The conjuncture of the clock striking midnight marked the end of the old year and the start of the new one.
meanings.sent5: The conjuncture of the sun setting and the stars appearing signaled the beginning of the night.
